description: The prime concern of Scheduled Caste Development Department is the progress in education. Educational programmes are being carried out on the basis that the everlasting growth of any society is possible only with its educational developments. There are 86 nursery schools being run by the Department, for primary education. We follow the LKG, UKG system. The department provide daily feeding charges and learning materials including the uniforms. They are provided Rs. 30/- per daily as feeding charges, Rs. 600/- for uniforms and Rs. 190/- as lump sum grant for each student. Each school has a strength of 30 students. Out of this 25% seats are reserved for children belonging to the general category.
title: Nursery Schools
funding_pattern: Rs. 30/- per daily as feeding charges, Rs. 600/- for uniforms and Rs. 190/- as lump sum grant for each student.

description: The lump sum grant is given to SC, OEC students studying in Government, aided and approved unaided schools through the headmistress of the schools within 15 days of starting of the academic year.
title: Lump sum grant

description:

Nursery school
-

Ist to 4th STD
-
Rs. 320/- *
5th to 7th 
-
Rs. 630/- *
8th to 10th 
-
Rs. 940/- *
Half the rate of the above is given to failed students
title: Lump sum grant rates
The stipend given to the students belonging to Vulnerable Communities (vedan, Arunthathiyar, Chakkiliyan, kalladi and nayadi communities are as follows:-

description: A special scholarship under CSS is given to the students belongs to SC, studying in 9th and 10th standards. Income limit Rs. 25,0000/-. Rate of the scholarship is mentioned below: Sholarships ( Monthly ) Book Grant
title: Prematric Scholarship for 9th and10th SC students (100% CSS)

description:
The Department is providing financial assistance to children of parents who are engaged in cleaning and prone to health hazards, without considering their caste or religion. Application should be submitted to the concerned SC Development Officer through the head of the school along with the certificate issued by the Village Officer/Secretary LSGD for proving their eligibility *

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Children of parents engaged in cleaning and prone to health hazards

procedures.step_description: Submit application to the concerned SC Development Officer through the head of the school along with the required certificate.

title: Prematric Scholarship to the children of those engaged in cleaning and prone to health hazards (100% CSS)
documents: Certificate issued by the Village Officer/Secretary LSGD

description: The Department gives the facility of reimbursement of tuition fees to students belonging to SC and other eligible communities studying upto 10th standard in Government approved unaided schools. Rates are as follows: LP, UP - fees Rs. 1000/- Special fees Rs. 333/- H.S. fees Rs. 1500/- Special fees Rs. 500/-
title: Tuition Fees re-imbursement for children studying in unaided schools

description: An amount of Rs. 2,000/- given to SC children from class I to VIII for purchasing uniform, bag, umbrella etc. This is a new scheme started in 2014-15.
title: Primary / Secondary Education Aid

description: The Department provides Boarding School facilities to the talented SC Students. Applications should be submitted to the district secretary LSGD along with the grades received in 4th standard examinations. The annual income of the parents should not exceed 1,00,000/-.

procedures.step_description: Applications should be submitted to the district secretary LSGD along with the grades received in 4th standard examinations.

title: Boarding Grant

criteria.description: Annual income of parents should not exceed 1,00,000/-

description: An amount of Rs. 25,000/- each is provided for remedial and special coaching for a total of 100 SC students who study in classes IX, X, XI, and XII.
title: UP gradation of Merit of SC students (100% C.S.S)

description: A Scholarship of Rs. 4500/- per year is given to the students up to 10th standard on the basis of marks obtained in 4th and 7th standard. The application is to be submitted to the District Development Officer for SC along with Caste Certificate, income certificates and grade certificates. Annual income of parents should not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-. An amount of Rs. 2,000/- is given for purchasing furniture for study purpose for students whose parents annual income is less than Rs. 12000/-. An amount of Rs.100/- per month is\n also given to students for having nutritional food.

procedures.step_description: Submit application to District Development Officer for SC along with required documents.

title: Shri. Ayyankali talent search scholarship

criteria.description: Annual income of parents should not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-

description: There are nine Model Residential Schools is being run by this department for providing better education to children from standard 5. Admission of the students will be based on the\na0 entrance examination conducted in the state level by the department. Notification regarding this will be announced during the months of January and February. Application should be submitted to the District Development Officer with caste certificates, Income certificates along with the eligibility certificate from the head of the present institution where the student is studying. Annual income of parents not to exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-

procedures.step_description: Submit application to the District Development Officer with caste certificates, Income certificates along with the eligibility certificate from the head of the present institution where the student is studying.

title: Model Residential School

criteria.description: Annual income of parents not to exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-

description: The department runs 85 Prematric hostels for SC students. The Department provides food, uniform(2 sets), school bags, shoes and monthly pocket money of Rs. 130/-,Travelling expenses during Onam/Christmas holidays are given. Rs.2,500/- is provided as mess charge for each student for a month. The students from standard V are admitted in these hostels.
title: Pre-Matric Hostels

description: The Department provides Rs. 1000/- as boarding grant and Rs. 750/- as uniform allowances to those students who are the inmates of hostels run by the voluntary organizations. 7 such hostels are in the state.
title: Subsidised Hostels

description: This sports school is located at Vellayani in Trivandrum which is established for the purpose of giving training to the students from Std 5 to those who have high talents in sports. The selections are done through region wise trials. 30 students are admitted in a class. Classes are upto 12th in state syllabus. Mess charge is Rs.200/- per student for a day.
title: Shri. Ayyankali Memorial Govt. Model Residential Sports School-Trivandrum

description: The Department provide financial assistance for educational purposes to those students studying +1 and above. At present the Post matric Scholarships are being distributed online through E-grants systems. Online applications are to be submitted in the beginning of the year. Following the online application, original copies of certificates are to be submitted to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer through the head of the institution. Caste Certificate, Income Certificate, copy of the SSLC and certificates proving the educational qualifications of the student should be attached along with the application. Rate of Lump sum grant is stated below. Plus two -\n Rs. 1130/- Degree - Rs. 1190/- PG - Rs. 1570/- Professional Courses Rs. 440/- to 3130/- according to the course

procedures.step_description: Submit online applications in the beginning of the year.
Submit original copies of certificates to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer through the head of the institution.

title: Lumpsum grant

description: A monthly stipend of Rs. 630/- is given to those students within 8 Km and Rs. 750/- is given to those beyond 8 Kms.
title: Stipend

description: There are 19 hostels being run under the department for those students admitted to the post matric courses. Department provides free food and accommodation along with Rs. 190/- as pocket money per month and TA at the time of Onam and Christmas vacation for the inmates. There are facilities for entertainment such as sports, games and library facilities in the hostels. Financial assistances are provided for the inmates of Govt. Colleges hostels, approved hostels of aided college and self-financed colleges. A boarding grant of Rs. 1500/- per month is given to those studying professional courses, who do not have hostel facilities.
title: Post Matric Hostels

description: Financial assistance for SC students achieving distinction/80% level grade in SSLC, +2, TTC, Diploma, Degree, and PG/Professional Courses. Applications along with caste certificate and mark lists should be submitted to the scheduled caste development officer.

procedures.step_description: Submit application form
Attach caste certificate
Attach copies of mark lists
Submit to scheduled caste development officer

title: Distinction/80% level grade

description: SC students who secure 1st rank in Medical/Engineering entrance examinations, students who secured A+ in all subjects for SSLC and Plus 2 are awarded gold medals.
title: Gold Medals for Rank Holders

criteria.description: A+ in all subjects for SSLC
A+ in all subjects for Plus 2

description: An amount of 20,000/- is given as financial assistance for long term Medical/Engineering entrance coaching to students who have secured grades above B+ for Science subjects in SSLC Examinations. Students can select their centers for coaching. The annual income of the parents should not exceed Rs. 4.5 lakhs. Applications should be submitted to the District Development Officer for Scheduled Castes along with caste certificate, Salary certificates and copies of the mark list.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students who have secured grades above B+ for Science subjects in SSLC Examinations and whose parents have an annual income not exceeding Rs. 4.5 lakhs.

procedures.step_description: Submit applications to the District Development Officer for Scheduled Castes along with caste certificate, Salary certificates and copies of the mark list.

title: Assistance For Medical/Engineering Entrance Coaching

criteria.description: Secured grades above B+ for Science subjects in SSLC Examinations.
Annual income of parents should not exceed Rs. 4.5 lakhs.

description: The Department provides financial help to those students who got admission on merit or reservation basis in self financing institutions and universities for professional courses. The amount of fees is on the basis of Government rates. In addition to that, stipend and Lump sum grants are also given. Online application be submitted along with the original copies of certificates to the District Development Officer concerned.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students admitted on merit or reservation basis in self-financing institutions

procedures.step_description: Submit online application
Submit original copies of certificates to the District Development Officer

title: Educational Assistance For Those Studying Professional Courses In Self Financing Colleges
funding_pattern: Government rates for fees, stipend, and lump sum grants

criteria.description: Admission on merit or reservation basis in self-financing institutions and universities for professional courses

description: The Department provides financial support to students admitted to Med/Eng Courses @ Rs. 10,000/- for medical students and Rs. 5000/- for engineering students. The applications are to be submitted to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer with relevant papers showing the admission details, caste and Income. Annual Income Limit of parents will be Rs. 1,00,000/-

procedures.step_description: Submit applications to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer with relevant papers showing the admission details, caste and Income.

title: Initial Expenses To Those Admitted To Engineering/Medical Courses
funding_pattern: Rs. 10,000/- for medical students and Rs. 5000/- for engineering students

criteria.description: Annual Income Limit of parents will be Rs. 1,00,000/-

description: Financial assistance of Rs. 5800/- per student will be provide to SC student studying in Ist year MBBS, BDS, BHMS, BAMS courses. Stethoscopes are provided to the first year MBBS, BDS, BHMS, BAMS students.
title: Distribution of Stethoscopes

criteria.description: Studying in Ist year MBBS, BDS, BHMS, BAMS courses.

description: Financial assistance of a maximum of Rs. 25,000/- is provided to purchase laptop for Ist year SC students of B.Tech, M.tech, MCA, Diploma (CS), BSC (CS), MSC (CS), MSC (Electronics), MBBS, BDS, BAMS, BHMS, BVSC, AH, B.Arch, M.Phil, PhD.
title: Distribution of Laptops

description: Course fees are provided for attending evening courses in government or govt. approved institutions. The application has to be sent to the District Development Officers through the head of the institution along with Caste Certificate, Income Certificates and certificates proving the educational qualifications.

procedures.step_description: Submit application to District Development Officers through the head of the institution.
Include Caste Certificate, Income Certificate, and Educational Qualification Certificates with the application.

title: Financial Help to Students of Evening Courses

criteria.description: Attending evening courses in government or government-approved institutions.
Meeting specific caste and income criteria.

description: Course fees are allowed to those who study correspondence courses under the universities.
title: Distance Education

description: Education concession are given to SC students admitted in aided colleges or central universities outside the state through merit/reservations for those courses which are not available in the state. The application should be submitted to the District Development Officer concerned the institution along with the Caste Certificate and Income Certificates. Educational benefits are provided to SC students whose parents are residing outside as part of their jobs. The application has to be sent to the District Development Officer for Scheduled Caste Development Department through the head of the institution along with the Caste Certificate and Income Certificates.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: SC students admitted in aided colleges or central universities outside the state
SC students whose parents are residing outside as part of their jobs

procedures.step_description: Submit application to District Development Officer along with Caste Certificate and Income Certificate.

title: Education Concessions for those Studying Outside the State

description: Applications of financial assistance for SC students for studying abroad are considered by the Director of SCDD. An assistance of a maximum of Rs. 2,500,000/- will be given to eligible SC students.
title: Financial Assistance to Students for Studying Abroad

description: The Department give financial assistance to SC students studying in parallel colleges for plus two, Degree and PG Courses, who didn't get admission in government and aided colleges. They are eligible for the Lump sum grant and stipend as equal to the regular students. Tuition fees and exam fees are also provided. Applications should be submitted to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer, along with necessary certificates.

procedures.step_description: Submit applications to the District Scheduled Caste Development Officer, along with necessary certificates.

title: Educational Assistance for Parallel College Students

criteria.description: Studying in parallel colleges for plus two, Degree and PG Courses
Didn't get admission in government and aided colleges

description: Hostel buildings for girls and boys are being constructed by utilising the central fund through the public works department of the State.
title: Construction of Hostels

description: There are 44 Industrial Training Institutes all over Kerala under the department for giving training to 11 different trades in Electrician, Electronics Mechanic, Draftsman Civil, Mechanic (motor vehicle), Painter, Plunber, Carpenter, Sewing Technology, Welder, Surveyor, Driving cum Mechanic. Every year 1263 trainees are admitted. Among these 44 ITI's are accredited by NCVT. Those who pass the All India Trade Examination after completing their training with 80% attendance receive the Professionals as well as National Trade Certificate. The Department provides fees concession, uniform allowances, lump sum grant and monthly stipend. For admission application should be submitted to the concerned institution.

procedures.step_description: Submit application to the concerned institution.

title: Industrial Training Institutes (I.T.Is)

description: The department established Four pre-examination training centers at Trivandrum, Ernakulam, Palakkad and Kozhikode for giving training for different competitive examinations conducted by PSC, UPSC, Banking institutions and others public sector undertakings. Stipends will be given to the selected candidates. These centers also undertake coaching for Medical / Engineering entrance examinations.
title: Pre Examination Training Centers (PETC)

description: The Department runs a civil service training institution at Trivandrum for giving training to those who are interested in civil service examinations. Admissions are given those selected in the state level preliminary examination. Well established library, food and accommodation facilities, text book allowances of Rs. 3000/- etc. are provided. Training has been conducted through Kerala Civil Service Academy since 2018-2019.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Those interested in civil service examinations

title: Institute for civil service examination training society (ICSETS) Trivandrum

criteria.description: Selection in the state level preliminary examination

description: CREST (Centre for Research and Education for Social Transformation) has been established in the KIRTADS campus in Kozhikode in order to increase and strengthen the competitive capacity of the scheduled caste students. It play an important role in making the Scheduled Caste students efficient enough for enrollment in national and international educational institutes and getting jobs in multinational companies.
title: Centre For Excellence, Kozhikode

description: The Department runs two Para-medical institutes attached to the Trivandrum and Thrissur medical colleges and two other institutes in Palakkad and Kannur which provide training in D Pharm, B Pharm, DMLT and Health Inspector Course.
title: Para-medical Institutions

description: One set of reference books are provided to two students each studying in professional courses to the concerned institution (Rs. 2400/- to Rs. 7500/-). Also almirah for keeping the books are also provided (Rs. 4000/-).
title: Book bank scheme
funding_pattern: One set of reference books are provided to two students each studying in professional courses to the concerned institution (Rs. 2400/- to Rs. 7500/-). Also almirah for keeping the books are also provided (Rs. 4000/-).

description: The Department runs a medical college at Palakkad District which provide admission to 100 students out of which 70 belongs to Schedules Castes.
title: Palakkad Medical College

description: Financial assistance is provided to SC students studying in various arts courses related to music and dance
title: Financial assistance for purchasing Musical instrument:-

description: For students from higher secondary to professional courses, maximum Rs. 4000/- is given for attending the study tour programme conducted by the respective institutions. For this, application with necessary certificates should be submitted to the concerned District Department Officers.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Students from higher secondary to professional courses

procedures.step_description: Submit application with necessary certificates to the concerned District Department Officers.

title: Study tour assistance

description: Certificate programme in precision mechanist is being conducted in community college which is being set up in Vadakkanchery, Palakkad. Maximum of 40 students are admitted. SSLC / +2 passed students can apply and admission is through an entrance examination conducted. Course duration is 2 years.
title: Community College, Palakkad

description: The Department provides financial assistance to the individuals/self help groups who are interested in self employment. The project for self employment is to be submitted to the bank for loan and the Department will give 1/3 of the loan amount as subsidy. The subsidy amount is limited to 1 lakh for individuals and 3.5 lakhs for groups. Any venture can be started as part of self employment with the approval of the bank.

procedures.step_description: Submit the project for self employment to the bank for loan.
Send application to the block/municipal/corporation Scheduled Caste Development Officer.

funding_pattern: 1/3 of the loan amount as subsidy
title: Self-Employment Scheme
documents: Certificates showing educational qualification and age

description: The Department provides financial assistance for practicing as Advocates to those who have passed the LLB. This assistance is given for three years, after enrollment and starting practice as a Junior Advocate.
title: Assistance for starting practice as Advocates

criteria.description: Enrolled and started practicing as a Junior Advocate

description:
The Department provides apprenticeship assistance to those who have qualified in ITI, Diploma and Engineering. Application should be submitted to the District Development Officer for Scheduled Castes concerned. The monthly rates are as follows:- ·
 ITI - 2000/- · 
Diploma - 2500/- · 
Engineering - 3000/-

procedures.step_description: Application should be submitted to the District Development Officer for Scheduled Castes concerned.

title: Technical Apprenticeship

description: Graduates having Diploma in Computer application are given apprenticeship as clerk-typist on a monthly honorarium of Rs.10,000/- for one year to improve their employability.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Graduates with Diploma in Computer Application

title: Apprentice Clerk

description: The ITI certificate holders of Department ITIs are given financial assistance for purchasing tool kit in order to start their profession.
title: Tool Kit

description: The Department conducts trade fair twice in a financial year for showcasing the traditional products and the ethnic foods produced by the SC entrepreneurs and self help groups. This trade fair is organized by the Department along with Scheduled Tribe Development Department and KIRTADS. All the expenses including transportation, stall etc and TA&DA of entrepreneurs are met by the Department.
title: Exhibition cum Trade Fair (Gadhika)

description: The Department provides assistance of Rs. 100000/- to the job seekers who are willing to seek employment abroad. Age limit is upto 50 years and the family income limit is Rs. 2.5 lakh. The applicant can meet both travelling and visa expenses from this amount. The applicants can submit applications to District Development Officers concerned.

procedures.step_description: Submit applications to District Development Officers

title: Assistance for Seeking Employment Abroad

description: Training cum employment and income generating activities are provided through the projects submitted by the line departments under the pooled fund.
title: Pooled fund

description: An amount of Rs 3,75,000/-\\xa0 is given for purchasing minimum 5 cents of land in Panchayat area and Rs. 4,50,000/- and Rs. 6,00,000/- each for purchasing minimum 3 cents of land in municipal and Corporation are respectively. The beneficiaries are selected from life mission list(3rd phase).
title: Landless Rehabilitation

description: An amount of Rs. 4 lakh is given to houseless SC families for construction of houses, or dwelling unit in housing complexes under life mission.
title: Housing Grant ( Life Mission )

description: Upto Rs, 1,50,000/- is given for completion of incomplete houses constructed during the last 10 years, as additional assistance.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Individuals and families with incomplete houses

title: Completion of incomplete houses

criteria.description: Houses constructed during the last 10 years

description: The Department provides assistance to purchase land, construction of house and allied amenities to vulnerable communities such as Vedan, Nayadi, Kalladi, Chakliya/Arunthathiyar. An amount of Rs. 10,00,000/- for buying 25 cents of agriculture land, 5,00,000/- for buying minimum 5 cents of land and 6,00,000/- for house construction, Rs. 1,50,000/- for house repair, Rs. 40,000/- thousand for toilet construction to individual beneficiaries. Besides colony development programme and self employment activity are also taken up. Scheme is implemented based on action plan prepared by District Development Officers.
title: Vulnerable Community Development Programme
funding_pattern: Rs. 10,00,000/- for buying 25 cents of agriculture land, 5,00,000/- for buying minimum 5 cents of land and 6,00,000/- for house construction, Rs. 1,50,000/- for house repair, Rs. 40,000/- thousand for toilet construction

description: The Department provides an amount of Rs. 75,000/- as Marriage Grant for the marriage of SC girls. Annual income limit is Rs. 1,00,000/-.
title: Marriage Grant

description: The Department provides an amount of Rs. 75,000/- to intercaste couples (one of them should belong to SC) to overcome hard circumstances due to intercaste marriage. Application should be given after one year of marriage and before the completion of three years with co-living certificate. Income should not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Intercaste couples (one of them should belong to SC)

title: Inter Caste Marriage Grant

criteria.description: One of the partners should belong to SC
Marriage should have taken place within the last three years
Annual income should not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-

description: A maximum of Rs. 1 lakh/- can be given for treatment of serious diseases like cancer, heart, kidney, liver ailments and up to 50,000/- for other serious illness. Income should not exceed Rs. 1,00,000/-.

beneficiaries.beneficiary_type: Patients with serious diseases like cancer, heart, kidney, liver ailments and other serious illness

title: Health Care Programme

description: Homeo Health Centers are established in selected SC habitats in the state with the help of Homeopathy Department. These centers are started in areas within the radius of 2.5Kms where there are no health centers of any kind.
title: Homeo Health Centers (29 Nos)
